name: Fishlamp.github.io
body:
### Welcome to the FishLamp homepage.

FishLamp is a collection of small collections of code I call pieces - these pieces are meant to be aggregated together into your project. Each piece is meant to solve a specific problem or implement a specific feature. FishLamp is not meant to be monolithic. 

You consume and use these pieces using the awesome [CococPods](http://cocoapods.org) tools. (Note, I'm still working on wiring everything up to cocoapods, so we're not quite fully integrated yet).


### Pieces

The pieces are arranged like this:

[fishlamp-objc](http://github.com/fishlamp-objc)

These are the core pieces in objective-c that work on either iOS or OSX.

[fishlamp-osx](http://github.com/fishlamp-osx)

These are the pieces specifically for OSX.

[fishlamp-osx](http://github.com/fishlamp-osx)

These are the pieces specifically for iOS.

### Getting the code
```
$ cd your_repo_root/repo_name
$ git fetch origin
$ git checkout gh-pages
```

If you're using the GitHub for Mac, simply sync your repository and you'll see the new branch.


### Authors and Contributors
My name is (Mike Fullerton)[http://www.mikefullerton.com]. I've been working on FishLamp for a number of years now and am working toward the first fully open sourced release. If you're interested in finding out more, please shoot me an email at [hello@fishlamp.com](http://hello@fishlamp.com).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
